Returns: This value will never be null.
Parameters: boolean: true if this is an important person, false otherwise.
setImportant(boolean).Description: Sets whether this is an important person. Use this method to denote users who frequently interact with the user of this device when @B_android#app#Person#Builder#setUri_E@ isn't provided with @B_android#provider#ContactsContract#Contacts#CONTENT_LOOKUP_URI_E@, and instead with the mailto: or tel: schemas.

Returns: This value will never be null.
Parameters: String: a URI for the person. This value may be null.
setUri(java.lang.String).Description: Set a URI associated with this person. The person should be specified by the String representation of a @B_android#provider#ContactsContract#Contacts#CONTENT_LOOKUP_URI_E@. The system will also attempt to resolve mailto: and tel: schema URIs. The path part of these URIs must exist in the contacts database, in the appropriate column, or the reference will be discarded as invalid. Telephone schema URIs will be resolved by @B_android#provider#ContactsContract#PhoneLookup_E@.

Returns: This value will never be null.
Parameters: CharSequence: the name of this person. This value may be null.

Returns: This value will never be null.
Parameters: boolean: true if this person is a machine, false otherwise.
setBot(boolean).Description: Sets whether this person is a machine rather than a human.

Returns: This value will never be null.
build().Description: Creates and returns the @B_android#app#Person_E@ this builder represents.

Returns: This value will never be null.
Parameters: String: the key that uniquely identifies this person. This value may be null.
setKey(java.lang.String).Description: Add a key to this person in order to uniquely identify it. This is especially useful if the name doesn't uniquely identify this person or if the display name is a short handle of the actual name. If no key is provided, the name serves as the key for the purpose of identification.

Returns: This value will never be null.
Parameters: Icon: the icon of the person. This value may be null.
setIcon(android.graphics.drawable.Icon).Description: Add an icon for this person. The system will prefer this icon over any images that are resolved from the URI.
